title: Comparative Analysis of Learning Motivation Factors by Blended Learning Methods and Application Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Elementary Mathematical Concepts and Online Learning Experience
context.additional_context: Flexible blended learning course (face-to-face/online/hybrid) tailored to individual learning motivations, emphasizing practical mathematics competency development for employment preparation.

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain at least three motivational factors across face-to-face/online/hybrid learning modalities.
Learners can design and implement blended learning strategies tailored to their learning style.
Learners can analyze motivational factors (learning efficiency, social interaction, flexibility, etc.) in math problem-solving processes to improve learning effectiveness by over 20%.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
